column5: I picked up a small fiberglass runabout with a merc. 65 hp blue band motor and a Viking  55 hp for 200 bucks on the weekend.  The hull is toast needs new transom stringers and floors.  And I'm not up for the work.   Anyone know if simcoe transfer station will take it as is or do I need to cut it up? On the same note if anyone has an old aluminum hull  sitting around the need gone  give me a holler, have trailer will Tavel.
I did unload an old traveler a few years ago. No charge. But Im a Barrie res.
These guys take boats and grind them up.  http://www.sandycovemarine.com/Page.aspx/pageId/30181/Sandy-Cove-Marine-Recyclers.aspx
Also took a tent trailer to the dump that was when I was living in gravenhurst though.
Wow....that's pretty cool!  Thanks for the link.

They used to take boats at the dump north of Bradford off 11  Just before we came up here a year and a half ago our last run to the dump was entertaining, drove down from Stroud with a bunch of stuff, the guy ahead of us went in with an old full size camper trailer the boys went of and thru it with the front end loader, looked like monster jam.
Dump takes fiberglass boats.  50 bucks later boat gone...  Friday iim going to pick up my new to me Starcraft.
And sandy cove wanted 150 to grind er up.    They said they have been grinding the stuff up but they have no body to sell it too.  Said it was approved for use in concrete but nobody's buying.
